verses.verse: My soul<WH5315> is weary<WH5354> of my life<WH2416>; I will leave<WH5800> my complaint<WH7879> upon myself; I will speak<WH1696> in the bitterness<WH4751> of my soul<WH5315>. weary: or, cut off while I live
I will say<WH559> unto God<WH433>, Do not condemn<WH7561> me; shew<WH3045> me wherefore thou contendest<WH7378> with me.

Is it good<WH2895> unto thee that thou shouldest oppress<WH6231>, that thou shouldest despise<WH3988> the work<WH3018> of thine hands<WH3709>, and shine<WH3313> upon the counsel<WH6098> of the wicked<WH7563>? work: Heb. labour
Hast thou eyes<WH5869> of flesh<WH1320>? or seest<WH7200> thou as man<WH582> seeth<WH7200>?
Are thy days<WH3117> as the days<WH3117> of man<WH582>? are thy years<WH8141> as man's<WH1397> days<WH3117>,
That thou enquirest<WH1245> after mine iniquity<WH5771>, and searchest<WH1875> after my sin<WH2403>?
Thou knowest<WH1847> that I am not wicked<WH7561>; and there is none that can deliver<WH5337> out of thine hand<WH3027>. Thou: Heb. It is upon thy knowledge
Thine hands<WH3027> have made<WH6087> me and fashioned<WH6213> me together<WH3162> round about<WH5439>; yet thou dost destroy<WH1104> me. have: Heb. took pains about me
Remember<WH2142>, I beseech thee, that thou hast made<WH6213> me as the clay<WH2563>; and wilt thou bring<WH7725> me into dust<WH6083> again<WH7725>?
Hast thou not poured me out<WH5413> as milk<WH2461>, and curdled<WH7087> me like cheese<WH1385>?
Thou hast clothed<WH3847> me with skin<WH5785> and flesh<WH1320>, and hast fenced<WH7753> me with bones<WH6106> and sinews<WH1517>. fenced: Heb. hedged
Thou hast granted<WH6213> me life<WH2416> and favour<WH2617>, and thy visitation<WH6486> hath preserved<WH8104> my spirit<WH7307>.
And these things hast thou hid<WH6845> in thine heart<WH3824>: I know<WH3045> that this is with thee.
If I sin<WH2398>, then thou markest<WH8104> me, and thou wilt not acquit<WH5352> me from mine iniquity<WH5771>.

If I be wicked<WH7561>, woe<WH480> unto me; and if I be righteous<WH6663>, yet will I not lift up<WH5375> my head<WH7218>. I am full<WH7649> of confusion<WH7036>; therefore see<WH7202> <WH7200> thou mine affliction<WH6040>;
For it increaseth<WH1342>. Thou huntest<WH6679> me as a fierce lion<WH7826>: and again<WH7725> thou shewest thyself marvellous<WH6381> upon me.

Thou renewest<WH2318> thy witnesses<WH5707> against me, and increasest<WH7235> thine indignation<WH3708> upon me<WH5978>; changes<WH2487> and war<WH6635> are against me. witnesses: that is, thy plagues
Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth<WH3318> out of the womb<WH7358>? Oh that I had given up the ghost<WH1478>, and no eye<WH5869> had seen<WH7200> me!
I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried<WH2986> from the womb<WH990> to the grave<WH6913>.
Are not my days<WH3117> few<WH4592>? cease<WH2308> <WH2308> then, and let me alone<WH7896> <WH7896>, that I may take comfort<WH1082> a little<WH4592>,
Before I go<WH3212> whence I shall not return<WH7725>, even to the land<WH776> of darkness<WH2822> and the shadow of death<WH6757>;
A land<WH776> of darkness<WH5890>, as darkness<WH652> itself; and of the shadow of death<WH6757>, without any order<WH5468>, and where the light<WH3313> is as darkness<WH652>.
